results.title: Oliver & company
results.brief_description: An animal variation on the loved story of ‘Oliver’, this version is set in New York and finds Oliver, an orphaned kitten, playing with the likes of pickpocket pooches such as Dodger and Tito, both of whom are controlled by the human, Fagin. Oliver is pitted against Fagin’s evil boss and his killer Dobermans when Jenny, the lonely little rich girl who adopts Oliver after he finds his way into her limousine, is kidnapped. It’s up to Oliver and his friends to stage a daring rescue mission through the city’s subway system. Features music by Billy Joel, Bette Midler and Huey Lewis.

results.title: Olive Oyl's army
results.brief_description: Join Private Olive Oyl and her friend Alice as they go into training at Fort Dragg in eight adventure-filled animated cartoons. See our hero Corporal Popeye face all manner of challenges to win the heart of his dear Olive while Sergeant Bluto goes out of his way to make life difficult for one and all at the camp. And of course where there’s Swee’pea, there’s bound to be trouble particularly when Swee’pea takes a fancy to parachuting. Something for everyone to enjoy. Executive producers: William Hanna and Joseph Barbera.

results.title: Olive Cotton: photographer
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Millard and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Olive Cotton who began her career in the 1920’s is one of Australia’s most accomplished photographers. Her bold images, often associated with the “modernist” paintings and photographs of the 1930’s and ‘40’s, strike a strong chord with contemporary interests. Unlike many other female photographers of the period, Cotton did not restrict her work to portraiture but tackled a wide range of commercial subjects. This archival interview provides a unique look at the artist and her opinions of her work.

results.title: Olinda festival, 1952: festival presentations (CD)
results.brief_description: Audio recording of the 1952 Olinda Festival (later known as the Melbourne Film Festival), attended by over 600 film enthusiasts at two venues - Olinda and Sassafras - 26/01/1952 to the 28/01/1952. Interviewees: A. F. Bottomley, Pat Hanna, Stanley Hanna. Speakers include: G. S. Browne, Wilfred Selwyn Kent Hughes, Alan Ken Stout.

results.title: Olga de Amaral
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and S-M Productions
results.brief_description: South American Olga de Amaral is one of the most outstanding weavers working today. She is particularly noted for the sheer size and scope of her work. An exhibition of her work came to Australia in 1975 and here the camera explores the rich, earthy colors, the texture and intricacy of each piece. Olga de Amaral worked with only two materials, horse hair and hessian, and the way she used these materials is a source of wonder and delight.

results.title: Olga
results.creator_credit: John Sheppard and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: Olga Korbut is the Soviet gymnast who, at the age of 17, won three gold medals at the Munich Olympic Games in 1972 with a performance that caught the hearts and imaginations of a world-wide audience. This is a study of the hard and uncompromising disclipine that is a necessary part of a world champion’s daily life.

results.title: Ole eyemo sees the truth
results.brief_description: John, an imaginitive boy lives at a theme park with his aunt and uncle. After painting a third eye on his forehead, he uses his new organ of sight to gain small insights into the complex and confounding nature of human behaviour, fraught with contradictions between action and intention. Raises open-ended questions on human behaviour. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Old young man
results.creator_credit: Michael Ahnemann, Douglas Cox and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Bill Bradley, like any young man, is sorting out his thoughts and thinking possibly of a career in public life. But Bradley isn’t just any young man. He is a nationally known high school and college basketball star, Rhodes scholar, and member of a professional basketball team. See Bill Bradley through his own eyes.

results.title: Old Songs in a New Land: A Piece of Jewish Australian ...
results.creator_credit: Judy Menczel, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Inspired by an exhibition of the same name held at Hyde Park Barracks, Sydney 1988 and organised by the Bicentennial Committee, NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, this video portrays the history of the Jews in Australia from those who arrived on the First Fleet to the Jewish immigrants from Russia of the present day. Interviews with representatives of the Jewish community highlight the differences which still exist within the community which yet retains a distinctively Jewish character.
